intro: Asyneuma urceolatum, commonly known as the cup-shaped morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive cup-shaped leaves and trumpet-like flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other morning glories. It typically grows as an annual herb with trailing stems and produces small, edible seeds. The botanical features of Asyneuma urceolatum make it a unique and visually striking species within its native habitats.
